isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from hot coolant, do not remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet fittings until the cooling system has cooled down.

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and A/C switch are in the OFF position.
Close the heater water valves on the engine.

Under the cab, note how the heater hoses are connected to the heater core, and label the hoses for proper reconnection later. Remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet tubes ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Under Cab Heater A/C Routing

step1.para: Remove the Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Remove .
Remove the cab blend-door assembly. Refer to CAB BLEND-DOOR ASSEMBLY, Remove .
Remove the bunk blend-door assembly. Refer to BUNK BLEND-DOOR ASSEMBLY, Remove .
Remove the two nuts that secure the heater core to the bottom of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 12).
Remove the clip that secures the heater core to the inside of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 33).

note.para: In the following step, it will be necessary to cock the heater core to get the inlet and outlet tubes out of the pan that protrudes through the cab floor. The pan should stay in the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Lift the heater core out of Blend-Air unit ( Figure 34).

note.para: In the following step, it will be necessary to cock the heater core to get the inlet and outlet tubes into the pan that protrudes through the cab floor.

step1.para: Install the heater core in the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 34).
Install the clip that secures the heater core inside the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 33).
Install the two nuts that secure the heater core to the bottom of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 12). Tighten to 13 lbf-in (1.46 Nm).
Install the bunk blend-door assembly. Refer to BUNK BLEND-DOOR ASSEMBLY, Install .
Install the cab blend-door assembly. Refer to CAB BLEND-DOOR ASSEMBLY, Install .

Under the cab, connect the heater hoses to the inlet and outlet tubes on the heater core ( Figure 32). The inlet hose (smaller hose) should be on the tube closest to the center of the cab. Install hose clamps.
Open the heater water valves on the engine.
Check coolant level. If coolant needs to be added, refer to the Operator's Manual for the correct type of coolant to add.

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct heater and A/C operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Run engine and check operation of heater and check for leaks at the hose connections.
Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Install .
